comments:
I wrote a plugin to test the help toc and index contributions and ran into a situation where a bug in a contribution caused the index portion of the help browser to show an exception page. This was because I had neglected to set a keyword on an IndexEntry, but the help system should handle this situation better.

To reproduce:

1. Import the attached plugin.
2. Help/Help Contents
3. Select the index tab on the left

Where an index should be the following is displayed

HTTP Status 500 - 

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

type Exception report

message 

description The server encountered an internal error () that prevented it from fulfilling this request.

exception 

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.webapp.data.UrlUtil.JavaScriptEncode(UrlUtil.java:48)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.webapp.data.IndexData.generateIds(IndexData.java:106)
	at org.eclipse.help.internal.webapp.jsp.advanced.indexList_jsp._jspService(indexList_jsp.java:102)
	at org.apache.jasper.runtime.HttpJspBase.service(HttpJspBase.java:137)
	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:853)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:247)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilter(ApplicationFilterChain.java:193)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardWrapperValve.invoke(StandardWrapperValve.java:256)

	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invoke(StandardPipeline.java:480)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.invoke(ContainerBase.java:995)

	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline$StandardPipelineValveContext.invokeNext(StandardPipeline.java:641)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invoke(StandardPipeline.java:480)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.invoke(ContainerBase.java:995)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardContext.invoke(StandardContext.java:2422)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardHostValve.invoke(StandardHostValve.java:180)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline$StandardPipelineValveContext.invokeNext(StandardPipeline.java:643)
	at org.apache.catalina.valves.ErrorDispatcherValve.invoke(ErrorDispatcherValve.java:171)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline$StandardPipelineValveContext.invokeNext(StandardPipeline.java:641)

	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.processConnection(Http11Protocol.java:700)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.TcpWorkerThread.runIt(PoolTcpEndpoint.java:584)

Created an attachment (id=50675)
zip file of the plugin which shows up the problem.
Fixed. Webapp will now properly discard entries with null keywords.
